metadata.title: CVE-2023-2911 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
If the `recursive-clients` quota is reached on a BIND 9 resolver configuredwith both `stale-answer-enable yes;` and `stale-answer-client-timeout 0;`,a sequence of serve-stale-related lookups could cause `named` to loop andterminate unexpectedly due to a stack overflow. This issue affects BIND 9versions 9.16.33 through 9.16.41, 9.18.7 through 9.18.15, 9.16.33-S1through 9.16.41-S1, and 9.18.11-S1 through 9.18.15-S1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8').
